meanings.definition: To add caffeine to (a drink or food).
meanings.sent1: I will caffeinate my morning coffee to give me a boost.
meanings.sent2: She likes to caffeinate her tea with a shot of espresso.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally caffeinated my water instead of my coffee!
meanings.sent4: The energy drink caffeinated his body like a lightning bolt.
meanings.sent5: Caffeinating my drink makes it taste better and wakes me up.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something more alert or energetic by consuming caffeine.
meanings.sent1: Drinking soda can caffeinate you and keep you awake.
meanings.sent2: The students caffeinated themselves before the exam with energy drinks.
meanings.sent3: He tried to caffeinate his pet fish with a tiny cup of coffee.
meanings.sent4: The caffeine in the tea caffeinated her brain, making her thoughts race.
meanings.sent5: Caffeinating before a workout can improve performance and focus.
